page.title: 16Hiams Farms, Prickwillow
page.content: {Mr Green}has worked for Hiams for{36 {years.}He thinks its the next best thing to having your own farm. { 'I manage 5 Farms}now but the biggest is Putney Hill Farm where{Hiam Club } stands. It is 800 acres which together with the other farms totals{2,800 {acres.}It is the best we have to farm as it has Peat with a depth of 9 inches, it used to be 18 inches. We protect Crops from the wind but there hasn't been a bad blow for 8/10 years. A{Fen Blow}is like a big black dust storm. We do add{Manganese}but as the minerals from underneath mix we use less and less. We store all our Potatoes at Shippey Hill.It is called Shippey Hill because there was a time when Fen Potatoes weren't liked as much as the Highlands grown variety. So Frederick Hiams changed the names to help sell more.
